comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Walton Edwin Cruise (May 6, 1890 - January 6, 1975), born in Childersburg, Alabama, was an outfielder for the St. Louis Cardinals (1914, 1916-1919) and Boston Braves (1919-1924). In 10 seasons, he played in 736 games and had 2,321 at bats, 293 runs, 644 hits, 83 doubles, 39 triples, 30 home runs, 272 RBI, 49 stolen bases, 238 walks, a .277 batting average, a .348 on-base percentage, a .386 slugging percentage, 895 total bases, and 79 sacrifice hits. Also: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5853173492/]
